wikipedia_page.main: James Gifford, the elder (c.1739–1813) was a British Army officer and Unitarian writer.

response: Frend was a Unitarian and a Whig by conviction. Reformers such as Francis Burdett and John Horne Tooke were his friends, and he maintained correspondence with supporters of radicalism. Francis Place acknowledged an intellectual debt to Frend. Frend's Unitarian network, as well as the group round Priestley, included James Gifford the elder and Robert Hibbert. When it came to Godwin, Frend like others had difficulties with his atheism.Stephen Gill, William Wordsworth: A Life (1989), p. 90.
